fields.request: Manual QA: Verify startup log captures prestart refresh
fields.request_details:
1. On a node with systemd management enabled, note the service name from `cat locks/service.lck`.
2. Review the current contents of `logs/startup.log` and record the latest timestamped entry.
3. Restart the managed service with `sudo systemctl restart $(cat locks/service.lck)` (or trigger an auto-upgrade run) and wait for the unit to report `active`.
4. Open `logs/startup.log` again and confirm a new `[YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS] Running prestart environment refresh` entry was appended along with any env-refresh output.
5. Verify the log does not contain new error lines for the restart and that `logs/env-refresh.sh.log` also completed without creating a failover branch.
